intro: Pteroselinum sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian parsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the colder regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often used in traditional medicine and cuisine. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Siberian parsley is valued for its medicinal properties and is also used as a spice in some culinary traditions.
